meanings.definition: The quality of being expansive or capable of expansion.
meanings.sent1: Her artwork showed great expansivity, with colors and shapes spreading across the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The expansivity of the balloon allowed it to grow larger as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful nature had an expansivity that made everyone in the house smile.
meanings.sent4: His ideas had an expansivity that reached far beyond the boundaries of conventional thinking.
meanings.sent5: The garden's beauty had an expansivity that seemed to stretch endlessly into the horizon.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance expands when heated.
meanings.sent1: The metal's expansivity caused it to bend when exposed to high temperatures.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the expansivity of liquids to understand their behavior under different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter's unexpected expansivity in the oven led to a deliciously fluffy dessert.
meanings.sent4: The expansivity of the rubber band symbolized the flexibility needed to adapt to change.
meanings.sent5: The balloon's expansivity under the heat of the sun made it rise higher and higher in the sky.
